standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers; represent addition and subtraction on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram.

images.alt: Two rows of integer chips. The first row has 3 negative chips. The second row has 6 negative chips.

hints.content: We get a **zero pair** when a $1$ and a $-1$ combine to equal $0$.  This diagram only has negative integer chips, so there are no zero pairs. We can count up the total value.
There are $9$ negative units.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rows of integer chips. The first row has 3 negative chips. The second row has 6 negative chips.

Two rows of integer chips. The first row has 9 negative chips. The second row has 9 positive chips.

hints.content: We get a **zero pair** when a $1$ and a $-1$ combine to equal $0$.  The sum will be the value of the leftover chips, after we remove all of the zero pairs.
There are $9$ pairs of positive and negative units.  [[☃ image 1]]  There are $9$ zero pairs.

images.alt: Two rows of integer chips. The first row has 9 negative chips. The second row has 9 positive chips. Each positive integer chip is grouped with a negative integer chip. There are 9 groups and no chips left over.

hints.content: The zero pairs each equal $0$.  [[☃ image 1]]  There are no positive or negative units left over.
